reviews.sentence: needs updated. The toilet would hardly flush. When the person came to fix it he could not fix the problem. Then riding in the elevator with others found out their shower did not drain. This hotel seems to need updated and the bathtub in our room shower seemed dirty. For the money we paid I excpected better working bathrooms.

We went for a Cincinnati Reds game. The hotel about a 30 minute walk from the ballpark and there is a 1 shuttle as well. The hotel suited our needs although it could use a bit of updating. Overall we were pleased.

Clean and comfortable. We stayed 5 nights. Check in was quick. Hotel is in good location. Room was clean comfortable albeit a bit small for a family of 4. I noticed a few ants in the bathroom on our last night there was a small trail. I called the front desk but they were not able to access any spray as maintenance was already gone for the night. I wiped them up did not see any more after that. Breakfast was good. They have waffles eggs bacon sausage potatoes bagels fruit more. Coffee tea hot chocolate was available all day fresh baked cookies in the afternoon. It has an indoor pool which my kids loved. They do have towels at the pool but they are tiny. Bring a bathroom towel if you go swimming. Linens bedding were very clean in great condition. Beds were very comfortable but pillows were a little too soft for me so I had to use 2 to support my neck. The hotel is very quiet. Even though it was full we never heard any noise from other rooms. The only drawback was our view. We were hoping for a river view but we got a room facing the road which included a view of the liquor store next door. We requested a different room but they were booked to capacity and were unable to accommodate our request. The manager Tim did keep note of our request said if something came available he would let us know. Overall the staff was very kind courteous. If I ever had a need to go to Cincinnati again I would definitely stay here.

Great handicapped accessible room. Great room for a wheelchair user. Plenty of space to maneuver and an easy to use roll in shower. The only problem was using a lift to get my wife in and out of the bed. The sagging box springs interfered with the legs of the lift but I am sure that will be repaired as soon as they read this review.

The Best Hotel Staff I have Ever Had. My wife and I came into town to visit our son and his wife for a few days and we wanted a place close enough to the city so we could look around downtown during the day. This hotel was in a great location and could not beat the price for walking distance to the city. The general manager Beth seemed to be everywhere. She checked us in by phone she was checking the levels on the pool since her chief engineer was out I am a retired maintenance man of 45 years and one of my duties was pool care and she knew her stuff. she was even there to check us out. Once learning my wife and I had just celebrated our 60th wedding anniversary Beth made arrangements to have a bottle of champagne in our room when we returned the first night. We are not drinkers by a long shot but it will be a nice memento to have years to come.

Close to Cincinnati downtown. This Hampton Inn is on the Kentucky side of the river and appeared a little dated but looked like renovations were underway. We actually wanted to be loser to CVG but our company booked this hotel because it was a reasonable rate. All hotel personnel were very accommodating even when we arrived at 2 AM. It is located close to the bridge going into Cincinnati however the rooms were quiet and you could not hear the traffic outside. Lots of fast food restaurants close by bug could not find a higher end restaurant. Room had everything needed in standard Hampton style. Comfortable bed and good shower pressure.
Okay. spacious bathroom comfortable bed. Noise early in the morning from renovation could not sleep in. limited breakfast due to renovations. not on riverfront no view.

Visiting for dance competiton. My family I were in Covington Kentucky for a dance competition this past weekend and had reserved Hampton Inn about 6 months ago. This hotel is currently under renovations. I had hoped to get a renovated room however king rooms were the only rooms that had been renovated the hotel was booked so we kept the original plan of 2 double beds. The room itself was okay. It was dated but was clean and comfortable. The hallways were messy with sheet rock remains and needed to be vacuumed. The elevators were messy with the same type thing. Parking lot was messy as well. Aesthetically the hotel is not very nice. However I do feel once the renovations are done it will be just fine. Location is easy to get to off interstate. Breakfast was just average. Hotel staff was nice.

Good location. Older hotel undergoing remodeling. Great location to downtown and very friendly staff. I would stay there again in future but I would make sure to stay on a floor that is not undergoing renovation as it was noisy.

Disappointing stay for a Hampton. The staff were very accommodating and moved us to another room to try to mitigate the construction noise. The breakfast had many great choices and was plentiful. They are currently updating the facility and the construction noise and mess were a hassle. The doors started slamming at 6 AM and went till midnight. The pool looks great but it was really cold and the kids could only take it for about 15 20 minutes before wanting to get out.

Loved it so wonderful. Great locale sweet staff and even tho there was remodeling going on we was never disturbed by it. Yes there is a liquor store in the parking lot. Could be a blessing and or a curse but it never bothered us. We was. More Loved it so wonderful. Great locale sweet staff and even tho there was remodeling going on we was never disturbed by it. Yes there is a liquor store in the parking lot. Could be a blessing and or a curse but it never bothered us. We was there to enjoy a family outing and we had a wonderful time. Chevy at the front desk was super sweet and the breakfast bar was exceptional.

Changing to Best Western Plus location questionable. Renovations and brand changing to Best Western Plus this past week. The location is convenient but the area of town is a bit scary. Hampton moved down the street to Newport. The breakfast machines were broken. The breakfast that was available was a lower in quality microwave eggs bulk yogurt.

Nice Redo. Property was apparently renovated recently and is a nice hotel option in the Covington KY area. Breakfast is included but is average. The food stations are too close together so it is chaotic when crowded with guests and not relaxing.

Clean up to date helpful and friendly staff. We really enjoyed ourselves. It was my wife two daughters 46 and myself. We took a small getaway to aquarium and for swimming. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean and updated with a solid fitness area and pool. Also breakfast was much better than we expected. This is actually a hotel we marked as one we would return to when we are in the area with the girls. We were very pleased overall with everything was not expecting this to end up being one of our favorites but it is now.

The desk clerk was less than enthusiastic to greet us and our room was not ready until over an hour after check in time. Eventually the clerk gave us another room that was ready so that we did not have to wait any longer. The pool was great that evening however in the morning was closed for maintenance. Several of the items such as clock lights air conditioner were unplugged and non functional. We plugged everything in except it took a while to figure out where the air conditioner plug was located underneath the panel. We liked the comfort of the bed and the size of the bathroom. There was no hot water or decaf coffee available in the lobby in the afternoon evening. The best amenity during our stay was the breakfast which was hot fresh well stocked and the breakfast staff was attentive pleasant and helpful. The location of the hotel was within 6 minutes of the Newport Aquarium. There was a liquor store in the parking lot of the hotel. There was no other shopping or restaurants within walking distance.

Great time in a great city. Great hotel it was just remodeled Visited the city for the first time this was a perfect location and price. just quick Uber ride to downtown. Room was super clean staff was great.

Convenient family friendly hotel. We stayed in a suite on the top floor. the kids loved the view of the river and the bridge traffic. We loved that the room was spacious clean and quiet. All of the staff front desk to maintenance were so helpful and pleasant. The kids discovered the lollipop bell on the first day and thought that was so cool. The breakfast had a nice variety. We liked that there was free parking with a quick drive to various attractions Newport Museum center Reds stadium riverfront parks the hotel was also on the trolley shuttle line to most of those areas. We would definitely stay here again.

Great experience definitely be back again n highly recommended. The bed pillows. n linen were extremely comfortable. The room furnishings were very nice n updated. Very good breakfast with a wide selection. Staff was very knowledgeable n considerate. Hotel itself from the room lobby to the outside was very cleanNothing excellent hotel stay.

Very Nice Hotel. Second time staying at this hotel for local events. It is very clean. Updated decor rooms. Very comfortable. Good value for the price in comparison to other locations. Access to late night quick food. Easy access via car or car service to all parts Downtown Cincinnati and Northern Kentuckys Riverfront cities.
Pool was just remodeled great staff.
